intro: Psychotria turbinella, commonly known as the Turbinella Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Psychotria turbinella is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine by indigenous communities.
